Title: Quality Technician
Company: Công Ty TNHH LEGO Manufacturing Việt Nam
Location: Số 1 Đường số 3, Khu Công Nghiệp Việt Nam - Singapore III, Phường Bình Cơ
Job Description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join LEGO® Manufacturing Vietnam as a Quality Technician (IPQC) and become part of a team that thrives on innovation, excellence, and creating the beloved LEGO bricks that inspire imaginative play in children around the globe. Apply now and build a career that shapes the future of creativity!

Work Location: Our factory is based in VSIP 3, Binh Co Ward, Ho Chi Minh (formerly called Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen - Binh Duong). Shuttle buses are provided from Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa & Binh Duong

* We think it’s important that you’re in control of your data and as part of the recruitment process; Your direct application at the LEGO Careers Website will be prioritized. Please copy and paste the following URL into your browser for your application: https://www.lego.com/en-us/careers/job/quality-technician-packing-2d67dffb63fe1001ae491a434b920000

Core Responsibilities

• Perform in process audit, inspection and record according to quality plan (Classify of defects/issues, follow AQL sampling plan, and issue nonconformity (NCMS) report)
• Kiểm tra chất lượng trên chuyền theo kế hoạch (Phân loại lỗi/vấn đề, tuân thủ kế hoạch lấy mẫu AQL và đưa ra báo cáo về các lỗi NC)
• Participate to containment and corrective actions of NC materials, FG and follow up the problem solving till done, including the handling of quarantined FG and WIP.
• Tham gia vào các hành động ngăn chặn và khắc phục vật liệu hoặc hàng thành phẩm bị lỗi NC, và theo dõi việc giải quyết vấn đề cho đến khi hoàn tất, bao gồm cả việc xử lý nhóm hàng thành phẩm và WIP đang bị cách ly.
• Investigate root cause of quality issues, communicate to relevant Depts, and follow up the problem solving
• Điều tra nguyên nhân gốc rễ của các vấn đề về chất lượng, trao đổi với các Phòng ban liên quan và theo dõi việc giải quyết vấn đề
• Apply the basic statistical methods for data analysis and PDCA/Quality tools in problem solving
• Áp dụng các phương pháp thống kê cơ bản để phân tích dữ liệu và các công cụ Chất lượng hoặc PDCA trong việc giải quyết vấn đề
• Shiftly report for quality performance per department and QMS requirements
• Báo cáo theo ca về hiệu suất chất lượng theo yêu cầu của hệ thống quản lý chất lượng QMS
• Report any quality risks or abnormality to supervisor
• Báo cáo bất kỳ rủi ro hoặc bất thường về chất lượng nào cho người quản lý trực tiếp
• EHS and 5S audit in the assigned areas
• Thực hiện kiểm tra về An Toàn & 5S tại khu vực được giao
• Lead or participate to Quality Circle (Small Group Activities) and Track/ verify / validate improvement actions’ effectiveness in own areas
• Dẫn dắt hoặc tham gia Vòng tròn chất lượng (Hoạt động nhóm nhỏ) và theo dõi/xác minh/xác thực hiệu quả của các hành động cải tiến trong các lĩnh vực được giao
• Conform to and participate in internal/external audit (IMS, CCC, FSC, ...), LEGO Continuous Improvement (LCI) assessment and annual TIP setting
• Tuân thủ và tham gia các hoạt động kiểm toán nội bộ/bên ngoài (IMS, CCC, FSC, ...), đánh giá về các hoạt động cải tiến liên tục (LCI) và thiết lập kế hoạch bộ phận hàng năm.
• Stop production in case of identified serious EHS or Quality risk. Escalate and actively collaborate to immediately resolve the situation.
• Dừng sản xuất trong trường hợp phát hiện rủi ro nghiêm trọng về An toàn hoặc Chất lượng. Tăng cường và tích cực hợp tác để giải quyết ngay tình hình.
• Support relevant projects in plant.
• Hỗ trợ các dự án có liên quan trong nhà máy.
• Other tasks assigned from superior
• Hoàn thành các nhiệm vụ khác được giao từ cấp trên.

Play your part in our team succeeding

• Do line audit for Quality and EHS standards
• Kiểm tra dây chuyền theo tiêu chuẩn chất lượng & an toàn
• Leverage CI in shopfloor
• Ứng dụng cải tiến liên tục tại khu vực sản xuất
• Maintain conformance to regulation/internal rules and IMS standards
• Duy trì tuân thủ theo quy định/quy tắc nội bộ và tiêu chuẩn IMS
• Support production lines to solving quality problems, organization of immediate remediation on the lines, identification of the root cause of non-conforming production, line audits, archiving of documents.
• Hỗ trợ dây chuyền sản xuất giải quyết các vấn đề về chất lượng, tổ chức khắc phục ngay lập tức trên dây chuyền, xác định nguyên nhân gốc rễ, kiểm tra dây chuyền, lưu trữ tài liệu.
• Support incident investigation.
• Hỗ trợ điều tra sự cố .
ZERO vision – Our ambition and commitment to create and ensure safe and healthy work and to prevent all accidents, harm and work-related diseases to achieve excellence in health, safety and wellbeing.
Dare to Care – Everyone is committing to keep themselves healthy and safe by showing concern and awareness for the health and safety.
Only the best is good enough – The high focus on Quality goes back to the family DNA and the historic legacy of the LEGO Group.

Title: Packing Production Supervisor (Shift Leader)
Company: Công Ty TNHH LEGO Manufacturing Việt Nam
Location: No 1, Street No 3, Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen Town, Binh Duong Province, .
Job Description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join LEGO® Manufacturing Vietnam as a Shift Leader of Packing Production and become part of a team that thrives on innovation, excellence, and creating the beloved LEGO bricks that inspire imaginative play in children around the globe. Apply now and build a career that shapes the future of creativity!

Work Location: Our factory is based in VSIP 3, Binh Co Ward, Ho Chi Minh (formerly called Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen - Binh Duong). Shuttle buses are provided from Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa & Binh Duong

Core Responsibilities
• A Shift Leader, or Shift Supervisor, is in charge of providing direct supervision to employees at shift-based companies to ensure the business operates correctly, based on the plan to determine the demand for people needed to fulfill the production plan. Main responsibility is to lead shift team by example and be collaborative with members of other departments, supports and ensures change management within processes.
• Responsible for maintaining an exceptional operation in shift, ensuring safety and reliable operation of the packing production equipment.
• A Shift Leader performs leadership, management and organization tasks to ensure team members work efficiently and effectively during their shift. He/she will organize shift schedules for team members, monitoring attendance, tardiness and time off. Assigning duties to specific employees based on role and skills, conducting performance reviews and sharing feedback with both upper management and team members. Managing employees requests, managing confliction, motivates teams to achieve set goals.
• Pre Pack - Material handling, line setup, ongoing quality control of production and handling of finished products, manual insertion of material into PP.
• Final Pack – Material handling, folding boxes, inserting Prepacks, components and building instructions into boxes on manual and automatic lines, subsequent packing of boxes into outers and storage on pallets.
• Possess high-level LCI concepts, use LC tools proficiently, promote the development of Packing level projects or improvements, and drive team morale.
• Take the initiative to undertake the projects subdivided into the departments of Packing, and can motivate team members to take the necessary responsibility when there are opportunities for improvement.
• Have customer-oriented thinking, and respond quickly to meet customer needs, reflected in PMP KPI-related projects or improvement cases.
• Understand and regularly share LEGO official information.
• Be able to use English for email communication, and communicate in English within the scope of relevant technical processes.
• Take an active role in the implementation of specific actions to improve crew satisfaction and engagement, communicate with maintenance operators about their performance and provide feedback (both positive and negative), regularly discuss departmental conditions and relevant information on safety, quality, delivery, cost and incentives.
• Work closely with the training team of this department, such as the completion rate of process confirmation and the control of documents.
• LCI/Continuous Improvement:
• Support and drive continuous improvement activities within their respective regions.
• Support managers' continuous improvement projects.
• Support continuous improvement department assessments.
• A process to develop, train, validate and improve standardization.
Play your part in our team succeeding
• This position is designed to lead the shift team to ensure that the required tasks are completed while adhering to LEGO's principles of quality, occupational safety and environmental protection.
• Serve as a role model to influence team culture.
• Coordinate team tasks and be responsible for the smooth running of daily operation.
• Provide support and guidance for the day-to-day operations of the team.
• Safety first mindset.
• Ensure that the team KPI in SQDCP is achieved, if not achieved, corresponding improvement actions should be taken.

Title: New Product Introduction (NPI) Manager
Location: No.11, Street 6, VSIP II Industrial Zone, Thu Dau Mot City, Binh Duong Province, Đường DE3, KCN Mỹ Phước 3, Bến Cát, Bình Dương
Job Description:
About the Role:
We are seeking an experienced NPI Manager to lead innovation projects and drive new
product introduction from concept to market. This role requires a strong understanding of
electronic applications in furniture and the ability to leverage design principles from other
industries such as audio systems, computer hardware, automotive design, and electronic
appliances. The NPI Manager will collaborate with Design, R&D, Product Engineering,
Sourcing, and Quality teams to deliver breakthrough concepts that enhance functionality and
user experience.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead the end-to-end NPI process, from concept research to market launch.
• Explore and integrate electronic applications into furniture designs (e.g., smart features, embedded audio, charging systems).
• Research and adapt design innovations from automotive, consumer electronics, and appliance industries for furniture applications.
• Manage intern team focused on cross-industry concept research and 3D rendering.
• Facilitate Innovation Committee reviews, prepare presentations, and drive decision-making.
• Align cross-functional teams (Design, R&D;, Engineering, Sourcing, Quality) to ensure feasibility, compliance, and cost efficiency.
• Monitor KPIs: time-to-market, cost efficiency, quality compliance, and innovation success rate.

Title: Purchasing Planning Manager
Location: LOTTE MALL West Lake Hanoi, 683 Lạc Long Quân, Phú Thượng, Tây Hồ, Hà Nội, Lotte Mall West Lake Hanoi, 683 Lạc Long Quân, Phú Thượng, Tây Hồ, Hà Nội
Job Description:
1. Tendering & Sourcing Management
- Build up and standardize purchasing processes, regulations, and templates (Construction/MEP/Consultancy) applicable across four stores branches in Vietnam and Indonesia.
- Propose tendering plans and package divisions for each project (Malls, Department Stores, etc.).
- Lead the entire tendering process: invitations, bid openings, technical/commercial evaluations, vendor selection, and contract signing.
- Control post-tender activities: managing quantities, price fluctuations, and contingency budget estimations.
- Ensure all bidding activities strictly comply with Group regulations and procedures.
2. Cost Control & Financial Supervision
- Monitor the utilization of bidding-related costs and packages to ensure they remain within the approved budget line.
- Continuously evaluate and identify cost-saving opportunities and procurement practice enhancements.
- Oversee the payment process for contractors and suppliers to ensure compliance with contract terms and work progress.
3. Vendor Management & Governance
- Implement and improve pre-qualification and performance review processes to optimize the supply chain quality.
- Analyze vendor capabilities and periodic service quality to minimize resource waste.
- Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with local and industry-wide contractors.
4. Operations & Compliance
- Maintain and update a comprehensive database of high-quality vendors to meet the Group’s requirements.
- Implement and improve pre-qualification and performance review processes to optimize the supply chain quality.
- Analyze vendor capabilities and periodic service quality to minimize resource waste.
- Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with local and industry-wide contractors.
5. Other tasks
- Perform other duties as assigned by higher management.

Title: Trưởng Phòng Hành Chính Nhân Sự
Location: HCMC
Job Description:
Mục tiêu công việc: Điều hành toàn diện hoạt động Hành chính – Nhân sự tại Công ty và các chi nhánh. Đảm bảo tuân thủ pháp luật, xây dựng môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp và tối ưu hóa nguồn lực cho mục tiêu sản xuất - kinh doanh.

Nhiệm vụ chính:
Quản trị Nhân sự: Xây dựng chính sách, nội quy; quản lý lương (C&B), phúc lợi, BHXH, thuế TNCN; lập kế hoạch tuyển dụng, đào tạo và đánh giá hiệu quả (KPIs).
Quản lý Hành chính: Điều hành vận hành văn phòng, nhà ăn, tài sản, bảo hộ lao động (PPE) và an ninh; quản lý lưu trữ hồ sơ, công văn.
Tuân thủ & An toàn: Đảm bảo thực thi đúng Luật Lao động, an toàn vệ sinh lao động (HSE), PCCC và môi trường; làm việc với các cơ quan chức năng.
Hỗ trợ Sản xuất: Phối hợp chặt chẽ với các xưởng để đảm bảo nhân lực theo ca kíp; kiểm tra hiện trường đảm bảo vận hành an toàn.
Tham mưu & Báo cáo: Kiểm soát ngân sách nhân sự; đề xuất chiến lược tối ưu hóa bộ máy; phân tích dữ liệu và báo cáo định kỳ cho Ban lãnh đạo.
